meanings.definition: The speed at which something happens or is done.
meanings.sent1: The pacing of the race was fast, making it exciting for the spectators.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted her pacing to finish her homework on time.
meanings.sent3: The pacing of the snail was so slow that even the turtle laughed.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to slow down, matching the pacing of his heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The pacing of the clock's ticking echoed in the empty room.

meanings.definition: The act of setting the pace for a group of people.
meanings.sent1: His pacing at the front of the marathon inspired others to keep going.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's pacing in the classroom helped students stay focused.
meanings.sent3: The pacing of the leader was so steady that everyone followed without question.
meanings.sent4: Her pacing on the dance floor guided the group's movements like a conductor.
meanings.sent5: The pacing of the captain's speech motivated the team to give their best.

meanings.definition: The rhythmic pattern of a piece of music or writing.
meanings.sent1: The pacing of the song created a lively and upbeat atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The author's pacing in the novel kept readers engaged till the end.
meanings.sent3: The pacing of the poem was so catchy that it got stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had a natural pacing that made it easy to listen to.
meanings.sent5: The pacing of the drumbeats set the mood for the entire performance.
